title: deerhunter sans serif type, what is it?
content:
please can anybody ID this for me? thanks!

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20090731144254im_/http:/typophile.com/files/dh1_3577.jpg)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20090731144254im_/http:/typophile.com/files/dh2_4590.jpg)
author: neill k

comments.content:
[Impact Bold Condensed](http://web.archive.org/web/20090731144254/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/urw/impact/) is close, thiough not an exact match.

- Mike Yanega

So is [Helvetica Inserat](http://web.archive.org/web/20090731144254/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/adobe/helvetica-inserat/), which would need to be vertically stretched a bit.

- Mike Yanega

thanks for the suggestions Mike, gothic 13 from adobe is pretty close too [http://new.myfonts.com/search/gothic+13/fonts/](http://web.archive.org/web/20090731144254/http:/new.myfonts.com/search/gothic+13/fonts/ "http://new.myfonts.com/search/gothic+13/fonts/")  
the circular full stop is a mystery, everything similar ive found has square full stops....also check out the tailless G here (sorry for the bad quality scan)....

any other ideas anyone?

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20090731144254im_/http:/typophile.com/files/dh3_5462.jpg)

Red Roosterâ€™s [Gothic Medium Condensed](http://web.archive.org/web/20090731144254/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/redrooster/gothic-rr/medium-condensed/) seems to match pretty well, including the G, although the leg of the R is not quite the same. If the square period bothers you, you can replace it.

- Mike Yanega
